intro: Galium blepharophoron, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, and it is found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a hairy texture. Galium blepharophoron is valued in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support diverse insect populations.
